title: DOH backs bill banning soft drinks in schools
text:
DOH backs bill banning soft drinks in schools By Mayen Jaymalin (The Philippine Star)   12:00am 
MANILA, Philippines - The Department of Health (DOH) is giving its full support to the proposed bill that seeks to ban the sale of sodas or soft drinks and unhealthy beverages in schools. 
“That (soft drink ban) is already part of our standards for healthy settings in schools,” said Health Secretary Paulyn Ubial. 
The enactment of a law banning unhealthy drinks would boost the government’s programs since it will become mandatory for schools to provide only healthy drinks to their students, she added. 
In 2007, the Department of Education (DepEd) issued a memorandum prohibiting the sale of carbonated drinks and artificially flavored juices inside canteens of all public schools. 
However, Edukasyon party-list Rep. Salvador Belano said the sale of unhealthy drinks in public school continues despite the directive, prompting him to propose a law that regulates or bans the practice in all of the country’s 46,000 schools.
